Reviews.Title: “The Real Rome”
Reviews.Author: verogal
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Dina is more than a place to sleep. It's an experience. It is an easy three block walk from the largest train station in Rome. Part of the walk is down an alley that is decorated with graffiti. Unfortunately, that is not unusual in even the best parts of Italy. It is easy to miss the hotel entrance, as it is barely a break in the wall, but once you enter the glass door, it feels like you step into Rome of the past. The small lobby is clean and quaint. We were warmly greeted and escorted to a suspended wrought iron elevator right out of the movie "Inception". Our room was at the end of a long narrow hallway, but again, it was clean and felt safe. The room was very tiny only about 10x10 with the bed taking up most of the space. It felt almost like a cruise ship cabin. But there was a desk, chair, closet and room to unpack. Bed was comfortable.The bathroom was on the small side too, but clean with modern fixtures. The best part was opening up the ancient wooded shutters and being able to literally breathe in Rome spread out below. Breakfast was a few pastries, what looked like hotdogs and boiled eggs. They did have a good coffee machine and juice. We never saw another person at breakfast, either staff or guests at breakfast, which was a little puzzeling. Overall, this is a cute little place that is adequate for sleep and shower at the end of a long day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: pkrasn
Reviews.Content: The hotel has good location next to Termini Station with convienient connections to each part of Rome but this is the only adventage. The rooms are dirty and definitelly require renovation. The floor in my room looked like never cleaned. Tap was rusty and the tap water had grey-brown colour. Shower place was dirty and the showerhead plugged with rust and dirt so the water was splashing from everywhere but not from the showerhead. The hotel is located on the street with tram traffic so there was loudly in the room what was especially inconvenient early morning. Moreover there is no internet (WiFi) in the hotel! Fortunatelly we spent two nights in this hotel only and didn't pay much (40 Eur per night per double room).

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Alison186470
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Hotel Dina on a school trip. We were here for 3 nights and I feel that, in Rome, you really get what you pay for. this hotel was cheap and cheerful. The location is fantastic, so close to Termini station and within easy walking distance of the Coliseum and Forum. The rooms were basic but clean although the bathroom was tiny and the shower was quite temperamental. The only problem I had with this hotel was that the breakfast is only just adequate. The coffee was horrible and out of a machine and there were no tea bags for the duration of the stay. There was one loaf of fresh bread which you had to cut yourself and, unless you got there early, the yoghurts vanished! The reception staff were super friendly and helpful at all times but there was one member of staff who was most unpleasant and who shouted at our pupils when their key broke in the door of their bedroom. He seemed to think it was their fault, when it obviously was not. Another lovely man came however, and worked for a considerable amount of time to get the broken key out of the door and let the girl into her room. To sum up, this is a good enough hotel if you only want somewhere to crash while you are seeing the sights, but, if I was going with my family or staying for longer, I probably wouldn't choose it

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: LiviB_11
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hotel Dina for two nights on a school trip. The room and bathroom were quite small, but clean, and sweetly decorated. Breakfast was simple, but very good. There were some ants, but that is normal in hot countries. Hotel staff were helpful. Hotel Dina is in an amazing location, very near to the Termini Station, and all the tourist sites are in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “This review is on Hotel Orbis.”
Reviews.Author: zegorov
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Hotel located in the heart of the city. This is a good location. But living conditions are terrible. The room and bathroom are very small, but it's not the worst. In the hotel is very dirty with a lot of ants and cockroaches. During the first two nights we were bitten by some insects. The whole body itched and was covered with huge red spots. At our request the administration inn gave us a spray of these insects. For the use of air conditioning we were told to pay extra, but we did not understand how much. One said 15 euro’s, while the other 10. It's not saving money. If you want to enjoy your holiday, do not stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Confusing!”
Reviews.Author: Mars1771
Reviews.Content: This WAS the Orbis at #62 but they've taken over the Dina at 58. CHECK IN AT #58. I should have read the last review better and the signs and for the extra 10 Euro a night get a bathroom in your room! The guy knew little of what was in the room, POOR! Kept ringing me for the extra money once I'd changed rooms because of the flood in the shared bathroom, even after I told him I'd pay him in the morning when I picked up my receipt. (yes he was cautious) Loved hearing the music from my window. Room 306 was pretty ok as a twin

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convinient....most recommended for ROME”
Reviews.Author: nehabhushan
Reviews.Content: Me & my husband stayed at Hotel Dina for 4 nights in Sept. 2010. At first, on our arrival, we had a bit of difficulty as the recption staff didn't speak english well. But he tried to help nonetheless & we got a cosy, cleal room. The lift is old italian style but not problematic at all. The brownie point of this hotel is its excellent location, less than 200 mtrs from Roma termini & lots of eateries around. The hop on hop off tour also starts nearby. We totally loved our stay , & recommend it to anybody who is on a short trip & needs to use public transport frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, safe, cheap”
Reviews.Author: KhaledEffendi
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a short period of time and was quite satisfied by the hotel. Be aware, its not a pretty or fancy hotel, but quite reasonable for the price, safe and cheap. The hotel is located close to the central termini which is very useful, because you can either take the metro or the train from there. I would recommend this hotel for student and low budget traveler like me. The room I choose didn't have bathroom. But the one close to the room was appropriate, clean. As my title say, well located, safe and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: joym91
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. It was very expensive $150USD+ per night and had bugs on the floor. Even worse, my bag was stolen from the luggage storage area and the employee said it was my fault for trusting them with it. The employees were very rude. I tried to email management to give them a chance to redeem themselves, and they ignored my email. Don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: ermanno024
Reviews.Content: dont listen to the whiners. great value in a great location near all the attractions of rome. the room was clean and the staff was helpful and friendly. it is noisey at nite due to the sanitation trucks working at nite. the hotel is not air coditioned so you'll probably leave the window open on a warm nite. there are two great restaurants with reasable prices rite outside your front door ( 4 course meal 14 euro, glass of wine 2 euro, litre of wine 8 euro ) you cant beat that!..so if you want a clean hotel in the heart of rome stay at hotel Dina...If a little noise bothers you then stay somewhere else at double the cost.

Reviews.Title: “About Dina Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madalin81
Reviews.Content: Breakfast - very weak Rooms - quite small but clean Hotel - good position Staff - not very friendly Overall - good enough

Reviews.Title: “DINA HOTEL- A BIG NO”
Reviews.Author: ama1979
Reviews.Content: 1) breakfast- few things to eat and on Sunday the waiter told us that is no bread because every thing is closed and they can not provide bred for us. 2) the elevetor didn't work for one day 3) the room verry narrow and outside was till midnight noise

Reviews.Title: “Handy location. Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: MikiHo
Reviews.Content: The room was small but clean. Costs: 85 euros for a family of 4. Breakfast - 10 euros extra but I was not impressed with it. The area is quite noisy but if you are tyred enough it will not bother you (did not bother me or my family members). Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Basic with less than helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DublinNovia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel recently having seen how close to Termini station it is and also being attracted by the low prices. We had booked a "superior" room as having a 17 month old baby we thought we'd pay the bit extra for more space in the room considering the cot as well as our own bed. The website showed a spacious looking room which we presumed was the superior. On arriving late at night with all our luggage and the baby in the buggy, we discovered that to get to the reception on the first floor we needed the lift. Problem was, that lift needed a key to open it. Which was available at reception!! We dragged everything upstairs and were greeted by an unfriendl receptionist who completed our check in in virtual silence giving us little or no information about the hotel's facilities (subsequently we found there are none) Up we trekked to the 4th floor via the 300yr old lift and discovered that to get into the corridor you need to buzz reception and wait. Same to get in and out of all doors all over the hotel. Ridiculous. Our room was to our shock, tiny. We had barely enough room to walk around the bed. It was sweltering hot although the website had said superior rooms had A.C. This we were told was an extra €15 per night. Oh by the way, breakfast in this awful place was a further €15 per breakfast!! I complained at the end of our stay that the superior room was a joke, that we had nothing extra to the standard. A very rude female who I found out afterwards was the owner informed me that we had a safe in the room, the OPTION of A.C and a fridge (this was empty). That made it superior. To add insult to injury, my parents who had reserved a standrd room were put up in a palatial huge room complete with jacuzzi! It turned out Hotel Dina had run out of space so they were put in the hotel attached, the Terni. She was argumentative to the last and thoroughly unpleasant to deal with. We paid our money and left vowing never to return. The area it is in by the way is dodgy to say the least and dangerous to walk around in at night. The only thing that redeems it are the lovely restaurants around. Never again...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: bub0316
Reviews.Content: Positives--Hotel Dina is about two blocks away from the Termini station. Was very convenient to wake up and head somewhere via train. Price was cheap compared to other hotels in Rome. If you don't need much and just want a cheap place to sleep, this Hotel should work for you. Negatives--Location, although convenient for train, is in a more run down area of Rome. High level of street noise can be heard throughout the night. Hotel is also showing its age. We had a quad room and was very tight with beds built for hobbits. It was something we could deal with, but if you are a "needy" person or are used to North American chains this hotel would not be for you. Personally, if i ever went back to Rome I would not stay here. I would stay along the rail system in a nicer part of Rome. This area seemed very run down and actually gave us a disappointing first impression of Rome. Feel free to contact me with questions....

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: olska
Reviews.Content: ok hotel near to termini... small but very cheap... good good price/quality

Reviews.Title: “ROMAN VERSION OF 'FAWLTY TOWERS'”
Reviews.Author: Britcyp
Reviews.Content: Initial reaction was of 'Fawlty Towers' Italian style, where nothing was right. Stairs from ground floor to Reception on first floor. You need to request key to use lift from ground floor which otherwise operates from first floor and is used for both guests and services. Not advisable for anyone with impaired mobility / walking difficulty. First night horror of being told that we had to pay € 10 per day for air conditioning, despite this being included in the package for 'superior room'. Had to repeat the point to get concession we were already paying for. The room was grubby ... broken toilet seat and plug in bathroom basin not working. After some protestations and threat of going elsewhere we were moved to another 'superior room' in a refurbished part of the hotel, although this was not truly clean - bathroom stool had inbuilt grime on the seat. This room was much better and bed quite comfortable. Breakfast totally non-descript ... tepid hot water... expected to eat cereals from a plastic cup. Gave up after one day and resorted to our own supplies from nearby supermarket. Would never use this place again - grossly overpriced for what was on offer. Location is good though - close to main Termini railway station, but so are many other hotels, some of which are of a higher standard. Excellent restaurant directly opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay much attention to the older reviews of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NogginLofty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just come back from 4 nights in Rome without the kids (yay) and for the first 2 nights stayed in a perfectly good hotel called the 'Hotel Bright' in an area called Prenestina which is on the outskirts of the city. That was a nice enough hotel at the same price as the Dina but almost 1 a hour journey each way on public transport from the Termini station. We were staying over the 1st of May holiday weekend and found accommodation hard to come by on the internet (and City centre hotels can be very pricey) so we found the Dina just by walking in and checking if they had a place. The exterior does look a rather dingy and at first we felt we were chancing it but found it internally to be clean with an old fashioned charm. The room we had was small but recently decorated and priced accordingly at 65E without breakfast, and it was clean and quiet, staff helpful enough, and is positioned only 200m from the Termini station so it's right in the heart of where you want to be. Being our first trip to Rome and booking it at short notice we didn't have much time to research the areas for accommodation but we were very satisfied with what we stumbled on and if this is your price range then we would definately recommend this hotel. The area is safe enough and as said it's really well sited for walking / bussing or Metroing it to all of the sites. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but there are loads nearby and our recommendation is to opt out of breakfast (which is extra at 15E per person per day) which they serve in their breakfast room and do what the Romans do and pop out to the plethora of local cafes and have your coffee & pastries there. We found a great friendly cafe only 50m away serving a coffee & pastry for 3E per person if you do as they do and stand at the bar, although there's a 3E cover surcharge of you sit to eat. CONCLUSION - don't read the older reviews on this site as the place must have had something of a tart up recently.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, noisy, budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: PichiSpaniards
Reviews.Content: I've stayed just for a night in a single room. The room had a shower and a washbasin. I booked the room in Venere, where they explained about the timetable of the breakfast. As they gave information about it, it was clear to me that it was included, but it wasn't. The reception is in another building, so you have to go down, cross a hall, go up, check in, get the keys, go down, cross the hall, go up, go into your room, and the same thing when you have to check out. Rather uncomfortable. They didn't have change when I payed the room, so I had to go next morning when I check out to get it, but they didn't have it either. The room was clean, it had some shampoo, plastic glass, etc. It had air conditioning that didn't work, so I had to open the window, when I did so as it was a first floor it was very noisy, so I slept with the tv on in order to avoid listening all the noises that came from the people ouside. I will definetly come back because it has the cheapest price in Rome, close to Termini station. It was clean. I guess that for the price I payed it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel Bad Neighborhood Hard to Find”
Reviews.Author: antonteddybear
Reviews.Content: We walked past it before realizing it was part of a bunch of pensiones in a building. The only obvious sign is one which says HOTELS. Inside the building are 6 hotels, each floor of the building is its own hotel. The room looked very new. It was comfortable and had its own shower and toilette. To get in, we had to go to the registration desk of a different hotel on the opposite side of the building, trying to use an elevator which did not work. We walked up stairs to the reg desk at the Luna Hotel, checked in for the Orbis Hotel, and got our keys. The elevator worked going down, but not going up. The Orbis hotel has a lot of security cameras, and they buzz you into the entry. Orbis hotel appears to be a set of 10 rooms on one floor of a building. We paid 72 euros at Venere for the night. It is 2 blocks from the train station. If you walk outside the trainstation it would be exactly 2 blocks behind the McDonalds if you could walk thru walls. It is across the street from the hotel California, assuming you are facing both the Hotel California and the cheap internet-long distance calling stores. I called USA from the cheap long distance calling store, and talked for a few minutes. The rate was 6 cents per minute. My 9 minute call costed me only 54 cents total. Since this is only 2 blocks from Rome Central Station (also called Termini) it is in a BAD neighborhood. There are pickpockets and purse snatchers everywhere. Someone snatched our diet coke thinking it was a money wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Town”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl_873240
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Rome are very expensive, so I did a Google search of the cheapest ones in the heart of the city. I found the Orbis hotel through Venere, and although it didn't have any reviews, it was the cheapest inside Rome and very close to Termini Station. I was a bit worried about the cleanliness and safety, but didn't think too much about it. When I arrived, I was pleasantly surprised. The location is perfect, two blocks from Termini Station and very easy to find, located in a historic building, on the first floor, I arrived at the check in desk. There was no one there but I rang the bell. A nice lady said that I had to check in through Hotel Dina. Apparently, a couple of hotels based in the same building are run by the same family. There is the Hotel Dina on the left side of the building, and Hotel Orbis on the right side. I got a map, my key and went straight up to my room. It was small but had a comfy bed, bedside table with lamp, a sink with mirror, a spacious wardrobe, a desk, a TV and a phone. The ceiling was very high so in reality the room felt spacious. A huge window with a little balcony area overlooking the patio of the building was at the end of my bed. Overall, the room was extremely clean. I was provided with the hotel essentials such as shampoo, shower caps, etc. Linen (body, hand and face towels) were also provided. I took a room with separate bathroom and was pleasantly surprised to see that it was immaculately clean as well, if not a bit too small. On my first night I didn't hear any noises but on the second night a noisy family checked in and I could hear everything. I had read some reviews before so I knew to take my ear tampons. I put them on and slept like a baby. The only two bad things about the hotel were that you could hear people if they were noisy.. or doors closing. In my corridor there were only 3 - 4 rooms and not many people, so it felt like I had "the house" to myself. The bathroom's cleanliness didn't change even when the family used it before me, but that really depends on the other guests' hygiene. Breakfast was offered in a nice dining environment, but I didn't have any. Overall, I thought this was a great place to stay in. I really appreciated the location, which was spot-on. It took me literally 3 minutes to walk to Termini Station and the metro, and so many bus lines pass by the hotel too. There was a bar a few steps from the Hotel and room cleaning every day. I gave it 4 stars for the great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location nr station and walking distance to sites”
Reviews.Author: Ap82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near the station and though not in the greatest area, it is easy to reach and for us, arriving from the airport, on a budget and walking everywhere, it was a great base from which to see the sites. Rooms were quite average, good air con, basic bathrooms and tv. We did not have the breakfast or use any communal facilties. Not a luxury choice but one for those looking for a good budget choice.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Dina
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo, 62, 00185 Rome, Italy
